issuing_body: National Assembly of the Federal Republic of Nigeria
tax_type: All federal taxes (e.g., Nigeria Tax Act 2025, NTA Act 2025, royalties)
taxpayer_type: All persons (individuals, companies, etc.) chargeable with federal tax
intended_usage: Legal framework for federal tax/revenue administration
topic_tags: Tax administration, assessment, collection, NRS board, functions, confidentiality
supersedes_doc_id: Federal Inland Revenue Service (Establishment) Act No. 13, 2007
notes: Establishes NRS as body corporate for federal revenue; includes board composition, funds (4% of collected revenue), savings provisions; administers Nigeria Tax Act 2025 et al. (Second Schedule).

source_title: Joint Revenue Board of Nigeria (Establishment) Act, 2025
issuing_body: Federal Republic of Nigeria Official Gazette
intended_usage: Revenue coordination, dispute resolution, taxpayer protection
topic_tags: JRBN, Tax Appeal Tribunal, Tax Ombud, harmonization, disputes
notes: Published in Official Gazette No. 117, Vol. 112; pages A349-382; complements NTAA and NTA 2025?

issuing_body: Federal Republic of Nigeria Official Gazette, No. 117, Vol. 112?
tax_type: All (income tax, VAT, stamp duties, royalties, surcharge)?
intended_usage: Tax administration, compliance, collection, dispute resolution
topic_tags: registration, Tax ID, returns, self-assessment, audits, penalties, state IRS?

issuing_body: Federal Republic of Nigeria Official Gazette, No. 117, Vol. 112?
tax_type: Income Tax, VAT, Stamp Duties, Hydrocarbon Tax, Petroleum Profits Tax, Surcharge
taxpayer_type: Companies, individuals, trusts, non-residents, petroleum entities?Trusts, Partnerships
intended_usage: Unified taxation, compliance simplification, revenue optimization?
topic_tags: consolidation, repeals, ETR 15%, EDI incentives, hydrocarbon tax, VAT fiscalisation, development levy?
supersedes_doc_id: CITA, PITA, VAT Act, CGT Act, PPT Act, Stamp Duties Act, others (13+ repealed)?
notes: Repeals 13 acts, amends PIA/NITDA; introduces CFC/ETR/Pillar 2 alignment, EDI replaces PSI; KPMG summary confirms key changes

source_title: Deduction of Tax at Source (Withholding) Regulations, 2024
issuing_body: Federal Republic of Nigeria Official Gazette
tax_type: Withholding (deduction of tax at source) on income under CGT, CITA, PPTA, PITA?
taxpayer_type: Corporate and non?corporate recipients; residents and non?residents?
authority_level: Subsidiary legislation (S.I. No. 34 of 2024) under CITA, PPTA, PITA, CGT Act?
intended_usage: Prescribing WHT rules, rates, exemptions, compliance, and returns?
topic_tags: withholding tax, deduction at source, WHT rates, exemptions, small company threshold, remittance, offences, schedules?
effective_date: 1 January 2025 (with optional early application from 1 July 2024)?
supersedes_doc_id: All prior withholding/deduction?at?source regulations (generic, no specific S.I. numbers named)?
notes: Applies to WHT on eligible transactions in First Schedule; introduces lower rates for low?margin sectors, exemptions for small companies and certain transactions, and central templates for remittance and receipts; explicitly revokes all earlier WHT regulations but preserves actions already taken.
